required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Clinical Trial of a Computerized Contraceptive Decision Aid

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to conduct a randomized clinical trial of a web-based contraceptive decision aid compared to routine contraceptive counseling to evaluate the effect of the contraceptive decision aid on the contraceptive method selected by the participant.
The investigators primary hypothesis is that women utilizing a computerized Contraceptive Decision Aid (CDA) will be more likely to choose highly effective contraception than women who undergo standard clinical contraceptive counseling.

detailed_description.textblock:
Our primary specific aim is to test the CDA by conducting a randomized clinical trial comparing the CDA to routine contraceptive counseling. Our primary outcome of interest will be selection of highly effective contraception including the intrauterine device (IUD), the implant, and injectable contraception compared to all other reversible contraceptive methods.
We will also complete the following secondary specific aims:
1. We will use the validated Decisional Conflict Scale to measure decisional conflict pre- and post-intervention and compare the change in decisional conflict score in women randomized to the CDA to women undergoing routine counseling.
2. We will also evaluate satisfaction with contraceptive counseling and contraceptive continuation and satisfaction at 3 and 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Women Using IUD, Implanon and Injectable Contraception
primary_outcome.description: Percent of women using IUD, Implanon and injectable contraception compared to other less effective methods

secondary_outcome.description: The validated 10-item low-literacy Decisional Conflict Scale was used to measure decisional conflict pre- and post-intervention and compared the change in decisional conflict score in women randomized to the CDA to women undergoing routine counseling. A numeric score between 0 and 100 was calculated based on the responses with 0 indicating no decisional conflict and 100 indicating extremely high decisional conflict. Change in score was calculated by subtracting pre-intervention score from post-intervention score. A negative mean score indicates a reduction in decisional conflict, indicating that the intervention helped reduce decisional conflict for the participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported Continuation and Satisfaction Rate With Contraceptive Method

arm_group.description: participants will be randomized to completing the CDM tool
Participants will fill out a computer survey similar to CDM tool without the decisive factors and computer print out

intervention.description: Participants will be required to complete the CDM tool and receive a tailored print out of their contraceptive options based on survey answers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 18-45 years old
- At risk for unintended pregnancy and seeking reversible contraception at Center of Advanced Medicine or Washington University Resident's Clinic
- Willing and able to complete Contraceptive Decision Making tool
- English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have had a hysterectomy, bilateral oophorectomy, have undergone female sterilization
- Unable to give informed consent secondary to language barrier or cognitive limitation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
